title: I need to find an "S" like this, it is a script, maybe callipraphy, didot, type font.
author: cathylewis70

comments.content: Probably not so close, but the best I can find based on your sketch is **[Fireside Chat NF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701153728/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Nick-Curtis&ffam=FiresideChatNF%20-%20Medium&fid=be995941e51bb6988f62ab0d4eb71054&fsize=60&text=Ss&fit=1)** by Nick-Curtis [2003]

Interesting idea, a swirly font that combines a swirl with a ball terminal at one end and a plain swirl at the other end. Here are two fonts that give you your choice of these two effects. Janda Hide And Seek [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/kimberly-geswein/janda-hide-and-seek/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701153728/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/kimberly-geswein/janda-hide-and-seek/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/kimberly-geswein/janda-hide-and-seek/") and Emploi [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/emploi/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701153728/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/emploi/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/emploi/") Emploi might be more to your taste than Janda Hide And Seek. If you can tinker with fonts Emploi could be edited to give it balls where you want them.  
Don

Here is an attractive two ball \_S\_ design from Jessica Hische. Buttermilk [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jhische/buttermilk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701153728/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jhische/buttermilk/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jhische/buttermilk/")  
Don
